intro: Dipcadi balfourii, commonly known as the Balfour's onion, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is a bulbous plant native to South Africa, characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, spherical bulbs that are used for propagation. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
